title: The cobbles of Paris-Roubaix are waiting
content:

There will be more weeding and maintenance required on the course before this weekend, while teams have already begun to converge on northern France for recon rides.

The last wet Paris-Roubaix was held in 2002, and saw Johan Museeuw win his third cobblestone trophy. In the years since, a succession of warm springs has meant Paris-Roubaix has been a dry and dusty affair for almost two decades. With this yearâ€™s unusual shift in the calendar, however, the drought might be over.
